Dispute_Type: Genuineness of marriage for immigration purposes
Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was genuine or entered into primarily for immigration purposes
Procedural_Context: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Credibility_Assessment: Marriage assessed as not genuine by Board; Court found credibility evidence was overlooked
Legal_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine, entered into for immigration purposes
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Age difference, lack of cultural compatibility, timing post-refusal
Regulation_Cited: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Application_Error: Failure to consider relevant evidence supporting genuineness
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded for redetermination
Assessment_Standard: Genuine marriage assessment standard under IRPR s. 4
Evidence_Ignored: Photos and communications indicating relationship authenticity
Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine and not primarily for immigration purposes
Application_Factor: Timing of marriage after visa refusal
Decision_Outcome: Sponsorship application denied, appeal dismissed, judicial review allowed
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable decision due to ignored evidence
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Outcome_of_Review: Case referred back to a newly constituted Board
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Evidentiary_Issues: Relevant evidence of relationship genuineness was not considered
Procedural_Fairness: Deficiency in decision-making process due to omission of key evidence
Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on authenticity of marital relationship
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unreasonableness and evidentiary omissions
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 4 of the Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Failure to address all relevant evidence in decision
Omission_Type: Failure to consider supporting evidence of relationship
